content.body:
> <@noamr:matrix.org> zcorpan: how about `<link rel=expect idref=foo blocking=render>`? It's a tad more verbose, but then we can use IDRefs for future "internal resource links", they don't have to be "expect", and it feels a bit more consistent with links.

That seems OK
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @noamr:matrix.org
zcorpan: how about <link rel=expect idref=foo blocking=render>? It's a tad more verbose, but then we can use IDRefs for future "internal resource links", they don't have to be "expect", and it feels a bit more consistent with links.
That seems OK

content.body: Maybe confusing if it only works for `rel=expect` though
content.formatted_body: Maybe confusing if it only works for rel=expect though

content.body: zcorpan: after internal discussion we thought it could be `element=foo` instead of `idref=foo`
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: after internal discussion we thought it could be element=foo instead of idref=foo

content.body: It would work only for `expect` initially, but no reason why it can't be used for future internal links if the need arises
content.formatted_body: It would work only for expect initially, but no reason why it can't be used for future internal links if the need arises
